comments.body:
Why not:

```scala
  def apply[G[_]](
      resume: Either[Throwable, A] => Unit,
      get: G[A],
      lift: F ~> G)(
      implicit G: MonadCancel[G, Throwable]): G[A]
```

More names and easier syntax at call sites.

> More names and easier syntax at call sites.

That's what I used to have, but actually the call site with that is _so_ much uglier

https://github.com/typelevel/cats-effect/pull/1165/commits/d2d23a2513cdb53b0ac573e132ae53c7e9c520c1#diff-8d42a1f7ffbea3d266c76d171c65d92c

have a look, note how many type signatures we can omit
Also I think the higher-rank type is clearer this way, although probably the only one who'll ever notice is me :P

Ah I see what you mean. Okay that's fair.

And yeah, I do think the higher-rank is clearer. That's actually the very first thing I noticed. :-) Had to stare at it a while to convince myself that it was actually okay to do what I was proposing. We can leave it as-is then.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +69,73 @@  def apply[G[_]](
      implicit
      G: MonadCancel[G, Throwable]): (Either[Throwable, A] => Unit, G[A], F ~> G) => G[A]
}
